p: For A. petiolata, F. alnus, and R. cathartica, the uncertainty attributable to data set source was highest for models constructed with current climate conditions (Fig. 5, Supplemental Figs. 11– 15). For R. multiflora, the species with the smallest current distribution in Minnesota, uncertainty was more widespread in future predictions, both in terms of spatial distribution (Fig. 6, Supplemental Fig. 16) and overall value distribution (Supplemental Figs. 20 & 24).
